name: WRC 4 FIA World Rally Championship
description: Show off your style and win the FIA WORLD RALLY CHAMPIONSHIP 2013 season! Experience the 2013 season with the drivers, cars and courses of the WRC, WRC2, WRC3 and, for the first time, Junior WRC championships.

reviews.review_text: Rally is my favorite form of racing/competition and gotta say I'm very surprised how good WRC4 actually is, I played WRC3 and didnt like it much, but this is a huge improvement. The driving feel is awesome, the cars react how they should. The stages are simply amazing, they can be difficult and tight but that's what I love of rally racing. Multiplayer is great fun, I can only hope it keeps a good healthy community.  Comparing this to Codemasters rally titles:  Handling: WRC 4 Stages: WRC 4 Sound: DiRT 2/3 Graphics: DiRT 2/3  Codemasters take the sound and graphics department by far but gameplay is definitely better in WRC 4. I'm happy the official WRC titles made it to steam, totally worth the day 1 purchase.

I feel somewhat torn about this game. On the one hand it is a competent rally game we had not since Colin McRae Rally 2005 and Richard Burns Rally. On the other hand it has some serious flaws. The game has quite arcady driving physics, and if it is good or not for you, it depends on your personal preferences. This is a proper rally game, so it does not have any Ghymkhana, rallycross or baja nonsense. It contains 4 classes (WRC, WRC 2, WRC 3 and Junior WRC) and 13 rallies with 6 special stages each.  On the other hand the amount of roads is quite limited. Each rally has 6 stages, but there are driven mostly through the same pieces of road, so there are only about 2 unique special stages per rally. The fact that kept us playing old rally games was great amount of special stages and vehicles, there just is not enough of that. The game is capped to 30 frames per second, what is unacceptable for a PC driving game nowadays, but there are some methods to remove this cap. The game still has some bugs, which are not game braking, but still can be annoying for some people.  The bottom line is that if you are into rally games, get it on sale. It has too much flaws to be recommended at full price, but if you can get it cheaper, it is worth playing.

For those who really enjoy a *relatively* hard rally game, it's a good choice. I've played WRC2 on X360 and found the graphics really enjoyable (in despite of most critics), but for some reason, the overall graphic quality for WRC4 has dropped substantially. Why? I've played DiRT 1/2/3/SD and, indeed, Codemasters' graphics rule, but their increasingly efforts to bring DiRT closer to the X-Games had me very upset. We lack for a good real rally game with good graphics. But, if I were to choose between graphics and gameplay (as I'm being forced to do), here's my choice.

+ Graphics look alright + Destination instructions are authentic (even if it feels useless while driving) + More than enough cars and tracks  - Levels are uninteresting(ly made) - Tries to mimic the DiRT series but fails, it has no own soul - Too arcadey for an official game  Note: you'll probably have more fun with the DiRT games  [Rating: 62/100]

I would give it 10/10 if the multiplayer and network connections worked.   I signed up for an accout and a couple of times connected and played online multiplayer fine, and it was great. The other players show up as a ghost car, thoroughly enjoyable. But now even though I'm logged in it comes back with an error trying to connect online.  Rally game is superb, reminiscent handling to Colin Mcrae RIP rally games. Plays a little more realistic than Dirt 2.   I play with an XBox joypad, picked it up for $19.99 in Steam sale. I don't usually buy games unless they're really cheap on sale, but am happy with my purchase.   Now just fix multiplayer please, thank you!

I have not played this for long and for the first hour I couldn't get into it at all. I'd just come from DiRT 3 wanting longer tracks to keep me playing rather than navigating menu's every 5 minutes. I love DiRT 3 don't get me wrong, it's one of my favourite racing games on the PC. In my opinion it does few things better than this game. Car choice, out of car camera (specifically sense of speed using this camera) and sounds. The reason I didn't enjoy this game to start was the animation of the car seems off. There is no sense of speed when using an out of car camera, this really put me off wanting to play. I decided to push through though and experiment with the different cameras. Cockpit view has saved this game for me. The sense of speed is there and it has immediately become fun to play. The handling feels semi-realistic at most, but is certainly more so than the DiRT titles.  Graphics -4/5 Sound - 4/5 Gameplay - 4.5/5  TL:DR - If you love the out of car camera, then this game may not be for you.

I was interested but skeptical at hitting the purchase botton sense day 1 on Steam at the $40 price. Waiting for a good price I just gave in and paid the $12 sale price not expecting much, I am now about 4 hours into the game and really enjoying it. If your a fan of Dirt 1/2 you will enjoy WRC 4. It was a let down to find their was no TrackIR support, fancy DX11 not so fancy looking at a stand still but strangely looks great at high speed. I would recommend playing in cockpit view, a good headset, 360 pad and adjust the audio levels. All and all id say WRC 4 is great filler for a good price waiting for the next big rally game.

At this time, I've clocked over two hours on this game (Almost three hours straight in one night) and I have to say that I had so much fun. Cannot fault anything with this game yet I expected the graphics to be better. The quality in the photos on the store page are as high as they would be as you cannot adjust the quality to low or high. This isn't an issue anyway, for me at least.  The gameplay is great. I personally play this game with a pad and the controls are excellent. The cars reacts like it should, in different types of environments and elements.  There is five different levels of AI (1 to 5) such as 1 as really dumb AI to 5 as Pro - Professional. (I'm playing with 2nd level at the moment which seem to be 'normal' difficulty but I kept winning in the first place so it is getting boring however after this season I'm doing is finished, I will increase it to 3).   There is no support for this game if there happen to be an issue but luckily for me, there's no issues for me with my pc SO FAR.  Overall, I'd say 9/10.

WRC 4 by Milestone may not have the polish or production values of a Codemasters Title, but it's an excellent Rally game in it's own right.  It looks great, runs well, has a ton of content and a solid Career Mode. I've really been enjoying my time with the game.  I don't understand the seemingly negative reactions to the game, I would easily recommend WRC 4 to any fan of Rally Racing.  My advice to those seasoned in the Genre would be to disable all driving-assists, set the difficulty to 10 and damage to Heavy. Those are the settings I play on (using a 360 pad) and I find it to be a good challenge.

Even though the game tends towards a simulation, this should not discourage those players that do not care for car configuration or excessively realistic difficulty. Setting the player AI to 1 (from a maximum of 8), turning off most driving aids I was able to completely dominate each special stage, winning everything. So no frustration and the fun of experiencing the different tracks and cars. If you liked the DiRT series, this game can actually be easier to win (see above setting), but that it completely up to you. The visuals may be slightly older, but on my five-year-old PC (ATi HD 5850) the game runs at around 60 FPS solid, so no worries there. Definitely get it from the bargain bin if you like rally driving games.
